text.section:
A person in interest may request a unit of the State government to correct inaccurate or incomplete information in a public record that:
the unit keeps; and
the person in interest is authorized to inspect.

A request under this section shall:
be in writing;
describe the requested change precisely; and
state the reasons for the change.

section.section:
Within 30 days after receiving a request under this section, a unit shall:
make or refuse to make the requested change; and
give the person in interest written notice of the action taken.
A notice of refusal shall contain the unit's reasons for the refusal.

If the unit finally refuses a request under this section, the person in interest may submit to the unit a concise statement that, in 5 pages or less, states the reasons for the request and for disagreement with the refusal.
Whenever the unit provides the disputed information to a third party, the unit shall provide to that party a copy of the statement submitted to the unit by the person in interest.

text.section:
If a unit is subject to Subtitle 2 of this title, a person or governmental unit may seek administrative and judicial review in accordance with that subtitle of:
a decision of the unit to deny:
a request to change a public record; or
a right to submit a statement of disagreement; or
the failure of the unit to provide the statement to a third party.
